image.altText: Ninette Simons with severe facial bruising some days after the attack.

props.synopsis: Two men and a woman are charged over a violent home invasion and robbery in Perth's north in which an elderly woman was allegedly bashed unconscious and her husband tied up and assaulted.

title.children: Arrests made after brutal home invasion in which elderly woman was bashed unconscious

image.altText: A young boy sits on a bed, looking at the camera with a serious expression. Next to him are stuffed toys.

props.synopsis: A growing crisis of school refusal is gripping Australia, leaving families in a hidden struggle with blame, shame and the fear of a lost education.

title.children: 'No child left behind is definitely not a reality': The kids who want to go to school but can't

image.altText: A young woman of Asian background standing in a doorway

props.synopsis: Authorities say new scam figures show their action on scams is working — but consumer groups and devastated victims say it's nowhere near enough.

title.children: 'My body was shaking': The fake text message that led to Jenny's family losing their savings

image.altText: A boy stands on a beach. His face is blurred.

props.synopsis: The parents of the 16-year-old who stabbed a Sydney bishop have spoken publicly for the first time, painting a picture of a vulnerable and violent child with serious anger management issues, longstanding mental health concerns and suspected autism spectrum disorder.

title.children: Parents of teenage terror accused detail frantic hours before attack on bishop

image.altText: A composite image  showing a man in a hospital bed and a woman in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: After a Four Corners investigation exposed safety issues with spinal cord stimulators, more patients have come forward to share their experiences of complications from the devices or the procedures to install them.

title.children: 'I thought I was going to die': More horror stories are emerging about spinal cord stimulators

image.altText: Albanese, wearing a suit and cap, speaks outdoors, a woman in a high viz vest puts her hand to her mouth, crying.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is playing down claims he lied, made by organisers of a march to end family violence, as comments made after an "emotional" day.

title.children: 'Emotional' day: Albanese plays down organiser's claims he lied at women's rally about invitation to speak

image.altText: A man smiles with colourful face paint in the style of a unicorn.

props.synopsis: First Nations elders in Western Australia's north have led an Indigenous pride parade in Broome, as part of a week-long festival — the first of its kind for the state.

title.children: 'Historic' Indigenous festival in WA's north empowers Blak pride

image.altText: A woman with three children.

props.synopsis: Thousands of cases are lodged in the state tribunals and relevant courts every year. Case delays during the COVID-19 period have seen some states left with a significant backlog on top of the new cases.

title.children: Aussie renters are getting more clued up about their rights and for some that means going to a tribunal

image.altText: A sign in front of a person's face that says 'I'd feel safer alone with a bear'

props.synopsis: A lot of women in my generation started believing that younger men were the great hope to ending violence against women. We waited, but little shifted and women kept dying. It's time we start accepting there will need to be an emergency response to the epidemic of male violence.

title.children: The Albanese government is in the box seat as Australians rally against gendered violence

image.altText: sad woman looks out window

props.synopsis: About 16 per cent of women will have vulva pain that lasts longer than three months, and many of them "just put up with it".

title.children: 'A lot of women just put up with it': Understanding vulvodynia

image.altText: A graphic showing a hand holding up a phone, with an incoming call from a mysterious hooded figure.

props.synopsis: The number of scams reported by Australians has hit a new record high, even though the amount lost has declined.

title.children: Scammers are becoming more sophisticated – and Australians with retirement savings are a big target

image.altText: Leila and Sean

props.synopsis: Leila McDougall has been defying the odds since childhood. She’s overcome dyslexia, beaten cancer, and after sneaking into acting school, has written, produced and starred in a feature film to help her farming community.

title.children: Leila noticed her tiny town was suffering. So she took a $500k risk to make a difference

image.altText: A man in a store filled with toys and boardgames.

props.synopsis: Just when you thought global supply chains and shipping was back to normal, there are new issues leading to higher costs for importers, distributors and customers.

title.children: Retailers are struggling as shipping delays and costs make moving things more difficult

image.altText: A Bigambul and Kamilaroi artist wearing a black hoodie and beannie holds a golden lion trophy.

props.synopsis: The Toowoomba-born artist has been thrust into the global spotlight after winning a major award at this year's Venice Biennale.

title.children: You may not know this Australian artist, but he has just won the 'Oscar' of the art world

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a blue suit speaks to media, holding microphones, at a scrum outside court.

props.synopsis: Prominent rugby league journalist Paul Kent is stood down from his roles as a Fox presenter and News Corp columnist "pending an immediate investigation" by his employers into footage from a late-night fight on a Sydney street.

title.children: Man charged over fight with prominent sports journalist Paul Kent on Sydney street

image.altText: A close up of a man surrounded by rocks. He's wearing a caving helmet with a light. It looks cramped.

props.synopsis: The world of fossil collecting is much more DIY than you might think. Pitch black caves, weekend trips and volunteer spelunkers are "critically important" for scientific research.

title.children: 'No-one's ever been there before': How a team of cavers helped rescue a decaying 50,000-year-old kangaroo skeleton

image.altText: A laptop computer sits open on a bed in a dark room showing an email account on screen.

props.synopsis: The federal government is seeking public feedback on whether the eSafety commissioner's online enforcement powers should extend to cover hate speech, 'pile-ons' and deepfakes.

title.children: Should the eSafety commissioner regulate hate speech, pile-ons and deepfakes? The government wants public feedback on the idea

image.altText: Taylor Swift in a black and white image, not smiling, looking over her shoulder, long blonde hair

props.synopsis: Taylor Swift's new album The Tortured Poets Department has broken chart records in the UK, US and Australia, with Swift tying with Madonna as the female artist with the most number ones in the UK in official albums chart history. She's also beat a Beatles record.

title.children: Taylor Swift ties with Madonna in the UK and beats a Beatles record

image.altText: Seven Network's logo on a building

props.synopsis: Seven West Media has appointed a new director of news after Craig McPherson announced his departure from the company, while the ASX is enjoying a positive start to the week following strong tech led gains on Wall Street. Follow live.

title.children: Seven West Media announces leadership shake-up, ASX rises after Friday tech surge on Wall Street

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ICYMI: Star Entertainment chair David Foster departs
ASX gains at lunch, continues to offset Friday's losses
Seven West Media appoints new news chief amid turmoil

image.altText: A little girl walks past a house in Rafah destroyed by a missile. It is rubble and debris

props.synopsis: It comes as the White House says Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has agreed to listen to US concerns before it launches an invasion.

title.children: Hamas delegation heads to Egypt for ceasefire talks in hope of halting Rafah assault

image.altText: Jacinta Allan sits in a chair in bushland, speaking with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: For the first time, an Australian head of state or territory government will appear before an Indigenous-led truth-telling inquiry. Follow Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan's evidence in our live blog.

title.children: 'Bloody stains of colonisation' have been hidden from Victoria's history books for too long, premier says

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Victorian premier's call for Victoria to confront its full history
'It's about understanding why': Premier says Victoria's full history must be taught in schools
Victoria's history has deliberately excluded the 'bloody stains of colonisation' for too long, premier says

image.altText: Back of the head of a girl standing in front of blurred Maffra Secondary College sign

props.synopsis: Every couple of months Emily* faces racism by her peers at school, targeting her Indigenous heritage. The "hurtful" slurs have impacted on her wellbeing.

title.children: After joining a school in regional Victoria, Emily felt 'embarrassed and upset' about her Indigenous heritage

image.altText: A smiling woman holding a bouquet of flowers

props.synopsis: Investigators in Victoria believe a passer-by stopped along the Princes Highway to help the 33-year-old who has not been seen since. Her family is concerned and says her disappearance is out of character.

title.children: Police believe missing woman may have hitchhiked after car breakdown

image.altText: Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel delivers a mass for the first time after his alleged stabbing

props.synopsis: Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel has returned to the same Wakeley church where he was stabbed and given his first sermon since the alleged terror incident.

title.children: Bishop delivers first mass since alleged stabbing at Sydney church

image.altText: Woman and dog sit on grass and smile at camera in backyard

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory is losing thousands more residents interstate than it's gaining, meaning the jurisdiction is set to miss its 2030 population target of 300,000 people.

title.children: Paige loved living in the NT. But she's one of the thousands to leave in the past year

image.altText: Two ships nearly collide.

props.synopsis: China's coast guard confronts Japanese lawmakers in waters claimed by both countries in the East China Sea, which is the latest in a series of maritime disputes involving China and its neighbours.

title.children: China's coast guard challenges Japanese delegation at sea

image.altText: A mango cut open ready to eat.

props.synopsis: Demand for seedless fruit is growing and the technology needed to create new varieties is improving rapidly, but some in the industry say "the price point just hasn't been there" to convince farmers to grow them.

title.children: Seedless mangoes could be around the corner, but are shoppers willing to pay for them?

image.altText: three puppets including a blackboard and mr squiggle with a long pencil nose

props.synopsis: The National Museum of Australia has acquired the collection of the puppeteer Norman Hetherington who was behind the iconic television show, Mr Squiggle.

title.children: He inspired children to be creative, now Mr Squiggle is at the National Museum of Australia

image.altText: Manchester City teammates Mary Fowler and Laura Coombs hug after a goal during a Women's Super League game.

props.synopsis: After some "shocking shots in training", Matildas star Mary Fowler finds the back of the net when it counts for Manchester City, giving them a healthy lead at the top of the Women's Super League ladder.

title.children: Mary Fowler's hit and hope approach pays off with two goals as Man City extends Super League lead

image.altText: Three women looking into the camera.

props.synopsis: Youth Advocacy Centre CEO Katherine Hayes has today revealed police are investigating at least one sexual assault committed against a child while they were being held in an adult watch house.

title.children: Youth advocates are taking Queensland government to court over watch house crisis

image.altText: A composite image of AFL players, Darcy Jones, Tanner Bruhn and Zach Tuohy, Taylor Adams during matches

props.synopsis: The Giants brush aside the grand finalists to stake a claim, Geelong's on-field steel breaks Blues hearts, and the Swans' ruthless performance has set the stage for an epic encounter next week. Here are the biggest talking points from every game of round seven.

title.children: AFL Round-Up: Giants answer critics, relentless Cats charge on, Swans set up epic 'battle'

image.altText: An aerial image shows a town main street filled with buildings destroyed by a tornado

props.synopsis: At least four people have died, including a four-month-old baby, and scores have been injured after dozens of tornadoes swept the southern plains of the United States.

title.children: Four dead and scores injured after dozens of tornadoes strike Oklahoma
